009package imagingbook.common.geometry.shape;
010
011import java.awt.Shape;
012
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Curve2d;
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.GeometricEllipse;
016
017/**
018 * Implementing classes know how to create an AWT {@link Shape}.
019 * 
020 * @author WB
021 *
022 */
023public interface ShapeProducer extends Curve2d {
024        
025        /**
026         * Returns a scaled {@link Shape} for this object
027         * (default scale is 1).
028         * Must be defined by implementing classes.
029         * The interpretation of the scale factor is left to the implementing class.
030         * For example, for {@link Pnt2d} it specifies the size of the marker 
031         * (see {@link Pnt2d#getShape(double)}.
032         * 
033         * @param scale the scale of the shape
034         * @return a {@link Shape} instance
035         */
036        public Shape getShape(double scale);
037        
038        /**
039         * Returns a {@link Shape} for this object at the
040         * default scale (1).
041         * @return a {@link Shape} instance
042         */
043        public default Shape getShape() {
044                return getShape(1);
045        };
046        
047        /**
048         * Returns a fixed sequence of {@link Shape} items for drawing this object,
049         * which must contain at least one item.
050         * This is to produce graphic representations that are too complex for
051         * a single {@link Shape} item.
052         * The returned shapes may also be displayed with different strokes or colors.
053         * <p>
054         * By default, this method returns a single item which is the primary
055         * shape (obtained by {@link #getShape(double)}).
056         * Implementing classes should override this method if more than one
057         * shape must be returned 
058         * For example, a {@link GeometricEllipse} returns three shape items:
059         * (a) the ellipse curve, (b) the center mark, (c) the major axes
060         * (see {@link GeometricEllipse#getShapes(double)}).
061         * </p>
062         * 
063         * @param scale a scale factor (may be used or ignored)
064         * @return sequence of {@link Shape} items
065         */
066        public default Shape[] getShapes(double scale) {
067                return new Shape[] { getShape(scale) };
068        }
069        
070        public default Shape[] getShapes() {
071                return getShapes(1);
072        }
073        
074        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
075        
076        /**
077         * Checks if all points of the specified AWT shape are sufficiently
078         * close to this 2D curve. This is typically used to test if the shape produced
079         * by {@link #getShape()} coincide with this curve.
080         * Only the discrete sample points produced by {@link ShapePointIterator}
081         * are checked, not the points on connecting polygon segments. 
082         * Typical usage:
083         * <pre>
084         * Shape s = this.getShape();
085         * boolean ok = this.checkShape(s, 1.0);</pre>
086         * 
087         * @param s the AWT shape
088         * @param tolerance the maximum shape point distance from the curve
089         * @return true if all  points of shape s are closer to this curve than tolerance
090         */
091        public default boolean checkShape(Shape s, double tolerance) {
092                ShapePointIterator iter = new ShapePointIterator(s, 0.5 * tolerance);
093                boolean result = true;
094                while(iter.hasNext()) {
095                        Pnt2d p = iter.next();
096                        if (getDistance(p) > tolerance) {
097                                result = false;
098                                break;
099                        }
100                }
101                return result;
102        }
103        
104        
105        
106}
